info.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, Single-arm Clinical Study of the Safety and Efficacy of KD-496 CAR-T Therapy in Advanced NKG2DL+/CLDN18.2+ Solid Tumors

identified_line.line: 1. Subjects fully understand the study and voluntarily sign informed consent；

criterions.exact_snippets: Subjects fully understand the study
voluntarily sign informed consent

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Subjects fully understand the study
voluntarily sign informed consent

identified_line.line: 2. Age 18 to 75 years old (including 75 years old), male and female；

criterions.exact_snippets: Age 18 to 75 years old (including 75 years old)
male and female

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Age 18 to 75 years old (including 75 years old)
male and female

identified_line.line: 3. Patients diagnosed with advanced solid tumors by histopathology or cytology and failed at least 2 prior lines treatment; preferentially enrolled in gastric cancer, pancreatic cancer, etc. Standard treatment recommendations refer to the latest version of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) guidelines or the Chinese Society of Clinical Oncology (CSCO) guidelines；

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients diagnosed with advanced solid tumors
failed at least 2 prior lines treatment
preferentially enrolled in gastric cancer, pancreatic cancer, etc.

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Patients diagnosed with advanced solid tumors
failed at least 2 prior lines treatment
preferentially enrolled in gastric cancer, pancreatic cancer, etc.

identified_line.line: 4. Immunohistochemistry confirmed that NKG2DL/CLDN18.2 was positive (the sum of NKG2DL and CLDN18.2 positive scores ≥5 according to the principle of positive comprehensive score 0~12 points).Tissue specimens for IHC testing must be obtained within 1 year prior to registration for screening or, if not available, new tissue samples must be obtained from a recently obtained surgery or diagnostic biopsy；

criterions.exact_snippets: Immunohistochemistry confirmed that NKG2DL/CLDN18.2 was positive
the sum of NKG2DL and CLDN18.2 positive scores ≥5 according to the principle of positive comprehensive score 0~12 points
Tissue specimens for IHC testing must be obtained within 1 year prior to registration for screening
if not available, new tissue samples must be obtained from a recently obtained surgery or diagnostic biopsy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Immunohistochemistry confirmed that NKG2DL/CLDN18.2 was positive
the sum of NKG2DL and CLDN18.2 positive scores ≥5 according to the principle of positive comprehensive score 0~12 points

condition.exact_snippets: Tissue specimens for IHC testing must be obtained within 1 year prior to registration for screening

else_criteria.exact_snippets: if not available, new tissue samples must be obtained from a recently obtained surgery or diagnostic biopsy

identified_line.line: 5. Subjects must have measurable lesions as defined by the RECIST v1.1 standard;

criterions.exact_snippets: measurable lesions as defined by the RECIST v1.1 standard

and_criteria.exact_snippets: measurable lesions as defined by the RECIST v1.1 standard

identified_line.line: 6. ECOG physical status score 0 to 1;

criterions.exact_snippets: ECOG physical status score 0 to 1

and_criteria.exact_snippets: ECOG physical status score 0 to 1

identified_line.line: 7. Estimated life expectancy ≥ 3 months;

criterions.exact_snippets: Estimated life expectancy ≥ 3 months;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Estimated life expectancy ≥ 3 months;

identified_line.line: 8. Subjects must have adequate peripheral venous access for peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) collection;

criterions.exact_snippets: adequate peripheral venous access

and_criteria.exact_snippets: adequate peripheral venous access

identified_line.line: 9. Subjects must meet the following conditions prior to screening precondition. If any of the laboratory tests are abnormal, they can be reviewed within 1 week. If the following conditions are still not met, the screening fails:

criterions.exact_snippets: laboratory tests are abnormal

identified_line.line: 3. Patients have autoimmune diseases, have undergone organ transplantation or allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, and require long-term systemic glucocorticoid (local use allowed) or other immunosuppressive therapy;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients have autoimmune diseases
have undergone organ transplantation
allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
require long-term systemic glucocorticoid ... or other immunosuppressive therapy
criterions.criterion: long-term systemic glucocorticoid or other immunosuppressive therapy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Patients have autoimmune diseases
require long-term systemic glucocorticoid ... or other immunosuppressive therapy
and_criteria.criterion: long-term systemic glucocorticoid or other immunosuppressive therapy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: have undergone organ transplantation
require long-term systemic glucocorticoid ... or other immunosuppressive therapy
and_criteria.criterion: long-term systemic glucocorticoid or other immunosuppressive therapy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
require long-term systemic glucocorticoid ... or other immunosuppressive therapy
and_criteria.criterion: long-term systemic glucocorticoid or other immunosuppressive therapy

identified_line.line: 5. Brain metastases with clinical symptoms, except for patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery;

criterions.exact_snippets: Brain metastases with clinical symptoms
Brain metastases with clinical symptoms
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Brain metastases with clinical symptoms
Brain metastases with clinical symptoms
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery
patients who are stable and asymptomatic lasting at least 14 days after radiotherapy or surgery

identified_line.line: 9. Received chemotherapy, molecular targeted therapy, interventional therapy, or other antitumor therapy within 3 weeks before apheresis;

criterions.exact_snippets: Received chemotherapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... molecular targeted therapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... interventional therapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... other antitumor therapy within 3 weeks before apheresis

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Received chemotherapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... molecular targeted therapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... interventional therapy ... within 3 weeks before apheresis
Received ... other antitumor therapy within 3 weeks before apheresis

identified_line.line: 10. Patients have received treatment with genetically modified T cells (including CAR-T, TCR-T) or other immune cell therapy previously;

criterions.exact_snippets: received treatment with genetically modified T cells (including CAR-T, TCR-T) or other immune cell therapy previously
criterions.criterion: previous treatment with genetically modified T cells or other immune cell therapy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: received treatment with genetically modified T cells (including CAR-T, TCR-T) or other immune cell therapy previously
and_criteria.criterion: previous treatment with genetically modified T cells or other immune cell therapy

identified_line.line: 11. Female subjects who are pregnant or breastfeeding;

criterions.exact_snippets: Female subjects who are pregnant
Female subjects who are ... breastfeeding

identified_line.line: 12. Patients with AEs induced by previous anti-tumor treatment that have not recovered to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) ≤1, except for alopecia;

criterions.exact_snippets: AEs induced by previous anti-tumor treatment that have not recovered to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) ≤1
except for alopecia

and_criteria.exact_snippets: AEs induced by previous anti-tumor treatment that have not recovered to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) ≤1

identified_line.line: 13. Received any live vaccine within 2 weeks prior to enrollment;

criterions.exact_snippets: Received any live vaccine within 2 weeks prior to enrollment

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Received any live vaccine within 2 weeks prior to enrollment

identified_line.line: 14. Patients are allergic to precondition drugs (including not limited to fludarabine, cyclophosphamide), allergic to KD-496 injection ingredients (dimethyl sulfoxide, human blood albumin), or have a history of severe allergies (such as anaphylactic shock);

criterions.exact_snippets: allergic to precondition drugs (including not limited to fludarabine, cyclophosphamide)
allergic to KD-496 injection ingredients (dimethyl sulfoxide, human blood albumin)
history of severe allergies (such as anaphylactic shock)

or_criteria.exact_snippets: allergic to precondition drugs (including not limited to fludarabine, cyclophosphamide)
allergic to KD-496 injection ingredients (dimethyl sulfoxide, human blood albumin)
history of severe allergies (such as anaphylactic shock)

identified_line.line: 15. Other conditions that investigators considered unsuitable for inclusion;

criterions.exact_snippets: Other conditions that investigators considered unsuitable for inclusion

not_criteria.exact_snippets: Other conditions that investigators considered unsuitable for inclusion

identified_line.line: 1)Absolute neutrophil count ≥1.5×10^9/L, platelets ≥90×10^9/L, hemoglobin ≥90 g/L (no blood transfusion or erythropoietin within 14 days) 2)Coagulation parameters: INR≤1.5 times upper limit of normal (ULN), APTT≤1.5 ULN; 3)Liver function: total bilirubin ≤1.5 ULN; Serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) ≤2.5 ULN; 4)Renal function: creatinine ≤1.5 ULN or creatinine clearance ≥60ml/min (Cockcroft and Gault formula); 5)Lung function: SaO2≥92%; 6)Cardiac function: Cardiac ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥50% detected by echocardiography or MUGA 1 month before enrollment; 10.Male and female participants of reproductive age agreed to use an approved contraceptive method (e.g., contraceptive pill, barrier device, IUD) for the duration of the study until at least 12 months after the last dose of infusion and two consecutive PCR tests found no CAR T cells.

criterions.exact_snippets: Absolute neutrophil count ≥1.5×10^9/L
platelets ≥90×10^9/L
hemoglobin ≥90 g/L (no blood transfusion or erythropoietin within 14 days)
hemoglobin ≥90 g/L (no blood transfusion or erythropoietin within 14 days)
Coagulation parameters: INR≤1.5 times upper limit of normal (ULN)
APTT≤1.5 ULN
Liver function: total bilirubin ≤1.5 ULN
Serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) ≤2.5 ULN
criterions.criterion: Serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST)

criterions.exact_snippets: Renal function: creatinine ≤1.5 ULN
creatinine clearance ≥60ml/min (Cockcroft and Gault formula)
Lung function: SaO2≥92%
Cardiac function: Cardiac ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥50% detected by echocardiography or MUGA 1 month before enrollment

Male and female participants of reproductive age agreed to use an approved contraceptive method (e.g., contraceptive pill, barrier device, IUD) for the duration of the study until at least 12 months after the last dose of infusion and two consecutive PCR tests found no CAR T cells
criterions.criterion: use of an approved contraceptive method

identified_line.line: Healthy volunteers allowed

criterions.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

identified_line.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

identified_line.line: Must have maximum age of 75 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: maximum age of 75 Years

identified_line.line: 1. Serologically positive for HIV or treponema pallidum, or active hepatitis B (HBV DNA ≥500 IU/mL) or hepatitis C (anti-HCV positive with HCV RNA above the lower limit of assay detection)

criterions.exact_snippets: Serologically positive for HIV
Serologically positive for ... treponema pallidum
active hepatitis B (HBV DNA ≥500 IU/mL)
active hepatitis B (HBV DNA ≥500 IU/mL)
hepatitis C (anti-HCV positive with HCV RNA above the lower limit of assay detection)
hepatitis C (anti-HCV positive with HCV RNA above the lower limit of assay detection)

requirement.expected_value: above the lower limit of assay detection

identified_line.line: 2. Any active infection that can't be controlled

criterions.exact_snippets: Any active infection

identified_line.line: 4. History of severe heart disease, including poorly controlled hypertension (SBP >160mmHg and/or DBP >90mmHg), and any of the following conditions that have occurred in the past 6 months: prolonged QT interval syndrome, ECG shows QTc interval >470mSEC, congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association grade ≥ III), cardiac angioplasty and stenting, myocardial infarction, unstable angina, severe arrhythmia, or other heart disease assessed by the investigator as unsuitable for enrollment;

criterions.exact_snippets: History of severe heart disease
poorly controlled hypertension (SBP >160mmHg and/or DBP >90mmHg)
poorly controlled hypertension (SBP >160mmHg and/or DBP >90mmHg)
prolonged QT interval syndrome
ECG shows QTc interval >470mSEC
congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association grade ≥ III)
cardiac angioplasty and stenting
myocardial infarction
unstable angina
severe arrhythmia
other heart disease assessed by the investigator as unsuitable for enrollment

requirement.expected_value: assessed by the investigator as unsuitable

identified_line.line: 6. Other central nervous system disorders assessed by the investigator to affect the trial: such as seizures, cerebral ischemia/bleeding, dementia, cerebellar diseases, or diseases affecting the central nervous system;

criterions.exact_snippets: Other central nervous system disorders ... such as seizures
Other central nervous system disorders ... such as ... cerebral ischemia/bleeding
Other central nervous system disorders ... such as ... dementia
Other central nervous system disorders ... such as ... cerebellar diseases
Other central nervous system disorders ... such as ... diseases affecting the central nervous system
criterions.criterion: diseases affecting the central nervous system

identified_line.line: 7. Complicated with hematologic malignancies or other primary malignant solid tumors, except for the following cases: 1) patients with cervical cancer or breast cancer in situ with no evidence of disease for more than 3 years after radical treatment; 2) Patients who have successfully received definitive in situ tumor resection without evidence of disease for ≥5 years;

criterions.exact_snippets: Complicated with hematologic malignancies
other primary malignant solid tumors
patients with cervical cancer or breast cancer in situ with no evidence of disease for more than 3 years after radical treatment
criterions.criterion: cervical cancer or breast cancer in situ

criterions.exact_snippets: patients with cervical cancer or breast cancer in situ with no evidence of disease for more than 3 years after radical treatment
criterions.criterion: cervical cancer or breast cancer in situ

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients who have successfully received definitive in situ tumor resection without evidence of disease for ≥5 years
Patients who have successfully received definitive in situ tumor resection without evidence of disease for ≥5 years

identified_line.line: 8. Patients with unstable or active peptic ulcer or gastrointestinal bleeding;

criterions.exact_snippets: unstable or active peptic ulcer
unstable or active peptic ulcer
gastrointestinal bleeding
